CSS Transforms

Scale

affects the size of the element. This also applies to the font-size, padding, height, and width of an element, too. Itâ€™s also a a shorthand function for the scaleX and scaleY functions.

Skew

skewX() and skewY(): tilts an element to the left or right, like turning a rectangle into a parallelogram. A positive X value tilts the element left, while a negative X value tilts it right. A positive Y value tilts the element down, and a negative Y value tilts is up.

Rotate

rotates the element clockwise from its current position. matrix(): a function that is probably not intended to be written by hand, but combines all transforms into one.

Translate

moves an element sideways or up and down. A positive X value moves the element to the right, while a negative X moves the element to the left. A positive Y value moves the element downwards and a negative Y value, upwards.
